definitions: performer who serves as the butt of jokes for a comedian
person who allows themselves to be used as a tool by someone more powerful
examples: The comedian's stooge pretended to be an audience member
He played the stooge perfectly in their vaudeville routine
The manager was just a stooge for the corrupt executives
Don't be a stooge for their illegal schemes

definitions: simple seat without arms or back support typically having three or four legs
solid waste matter discharged from the bowels used for medical testing
examples: She sat on a wooden stool at the kitchen counter
The bar stools were covered in red leather
The doctor requested a stool sample for laboratory analysis
Regular stool examination helps detect digestive problems early

definitions: small porch or platform with steps at a house entrance
forward bend of the head and shoulders showing age or fatigue
examples: Children played on the brownstone's front stoop all afternoon
We sat on the stoop watching neighbors pass by
His permanent stoop came from years of heavy labor
She noticed her grandmother's stoop was getting more pronounced

definitions: temporary fix or substitute used until a permanent solution is found
examples: Hiring contractors was just a stopgap until permanent staff arrived
The emergency funding served as a stopgap measure for the crisis

definitions: brief stay at a place during a longer journey especially between flights
examples: We had a three-hour stopover in Chicago before continuing west
The stopover in Paris allowed us to see the Eiffel Tower

definitions: organized stopping of work especially as a form of protest or strike
blocking or obstruction that prevents normal flow or movement of something
examples: The factory stoppage lasted three weeks until negotiations concluded
Work stoppages cost the company millions in lost productivity
A stoppage in the drain caused water to back up
The referee called a stoppage to check the injured player

definitions: device used to close or seal the opening of a bottle or container
examples: She carefully removed the cork stopper from the wine bottle
The rubber stopper kept the chemicals from evaporating overnight

definitions: action or process of coming to a halt or causing something to cease
examples: The sudden stopping of the train jolted passengers forward
Stopping the bleeding was the paramedic's first priority

definitions: front side of a store that faces the street including display windows
examples: The bakery's storefront featured fresh pastries in the window
They decorated their storefront with holiday lights every December

definitions: building used for storing goods, supplies, or equipment in large quantities
rich source or repository of information, memories, or valuable things
examples: The old storehouse contained farming equipment from three generations
Workers loaded grain into the storehouse before winter arrived
Her mind was a storehouse of historical facts and dates
The library serves as a storehouse of community knowledge

definitions: person who owns or manages a retail store or small shop
examples: The friendly storekeeper knew every customer by name
The storekeeper opened early to serve the morning commuters

definitions: room in a building used for storing supplies, equipment, or inventory
examples: Office supplies were kept in the storeroom down the hall
The restaurant's storeroom was stocked with dry goods and canned items

definitions: single floor or level of a building counted from ground level upward
examples: Their apartment was on the third storey of the building
The fire escape connected all six storeys of the structure

definitions: large long-legged bird with a long neck and bill that feeds in wetlands
examples: A white stork built its nest on the church tower
Storks migrate thousands of miles between Europe and Africa annually

definitions: book containing stories especially illustrated tales for children
perfect or idealized quality like something from a fairy tale
examples: She read her favorite storybook to the children every night
The illustrated storybook won several awards for its artwork
Their storybook romance began with a chance meeting in Paris
The cottage had storybook charm with its thatched roof

definitions: main story or sequence of events in a book, movie, or television show
examples: The movie's storyline kept audiences guessing until the end
Writers developed multiple storylines for the television series

definitions: person who tells stories either professionally or as entertainment
examples: The storyteller captivated children with tales of adventure
My grandfather was a natural storyteller who could hold any audience

definitions: dark, heavy beer with a strong flavor typically made with roasted malt
examples: He ordered a pint of Irish stout at the pub
The chocolate stout had hints of coffee and caramel

definitions: kitchen appliance with burners or heating elements used for cooking food
examples: She turned on the stove to boil water for pasta
The electric stove had four burners and an oven below

definitions: space for storing cargo or the act of packing items for storage
examples: The ship's stowage capacity was twenty thousand containers
Proper stowage of equipment prevents damage during transport

definitions: person who hides aboard a vehicle or vessel to travel without paying
examples: Security found a stowaway hiding in the ship's cargo hold
The young stowaway dreamed of adventure in distant lands

definitions: position with one leg on each side of something
position of not committing to either of two opposing sides or views
examples: The rider maintained a secure straddle on the horse
His wide straddle helped him balance on the beam
The politician's straddle on the issue frustrated both parties
Her straddle between tradition and innovation defined her approach

definitions: straight section of a road or racetrack without curves or bends
examples: The race car reached top speed on the long straightaway
Drivers accelerated through the straightaway before the next turn

definitions: strip of wood, metal, or plastic with a straight edge for drawing lines
examples: The architect used a straightedge to draw precise building plans
Students needed a straightedge for their geometry homework

definitions: act of making great physical or mental effort that may cause stress
examples: The straining of heavy lifting caused his back injury
Constant straining to meet deadlines affected her health

definitions: narrow passage of water connecting two larger bodies of water
examples: Ships navigate carefully through the strait between the islands
The Strait of Gibraltar connects the Atlantic and Mediterranean

definitions: strong garment with long sleeves that bind the arms to restrain violent patients
something that severely restricts freedom of action, thought, or development
examples: The hospital no longer uses straitjackets for patient restraint
Houdini famously escaped from locked straitjackets during performances
Outdated regulations became a straitjacket for business innovation
The curriculum was a straitjacket that stifled creative teaching

definitions: single thin piece of thread, wire, hair, or similar material
beach or shore especially the area between high and low tide marks
examples: She twisted three strands of yarn together to make rope
A single strand of DNA contains genetic information
Tourists walked along the strand collecting seashells at sunset
The strand was littered with driftwood after the storm

definitions: extremely tight grip around someone's neck or complete control over something
examples: The company's stranglehold on the market prevented competition
Breaking the stranglehold of old traditions took years of effort

definitions: person who kills by squeezing the throat to prevent breathing
examples: Police searched for the strangler who terrorized the neighborhood
The serial strangler left distinctive marks on each victim

definitions: act of killing or harming by squeezing the throat to stop breathing
examples: The detective found evidence of strangling on the victim's neck
Strangling of innovation occurs when bureaucracy becomes excessive

definitions: act of killing by compressing the throat or the state of being strangled
examples: The coroner determined strangulation as the cause of death
Economic strangulation forced many small businesses to close permanently

definitions: strip of leather, fabric, or other material used for fastening or carrying
examples: She adjusted the strap on her backpack for comfort
The watch strap was made of genuine Italian leather

definitions: carefully planned scheme or trick designed to achieve a particular goal
examples: The general's stratagem caught the enemy forces completely off guard
Her stratagem for getting promoted involved strategic networking

definitions: person skilled in planning and directing operations to achieve specific goals
examples: The political strategist planned every detail of the campaign
Chess masters are natural strategists who think many moves ahead

definitions: arrangement or classification of something into different layers, levels, or social classes
examples: Social stratification created barriers between economic classes
Rock stratification reveals millions of years of geological history

definitions: layer of Earth's atmosphere above the troposphere extending from about 10 to 50 kilometers high
examples: Commercial jets fly in the lower stratosphere for smoother travel
The ozone layer in the stratosphere protects us from radiation

definitions: layer of rock or soil with internally consistent characteristics
level or class in society based on social or economic position
examples: Each stratum of rock told a different geological story
Archaeologists carefully excavated each stratum to preserve artifacts
People from every stratum of society attended the public meeting
Moving between social strata was difficult in Victorian England

definitions: dried stalks of grain plants used as animal bedding or fodder
thin tube used for sucking liquid from a container
examples: Farmers spread fresh straw in the horse stalls daily
The scarecrow was stuffed with old straw from the barn
She sipped her smoothie through a reusable metal straw
Paper straws replaced plastic ones at the restaurant

definitions: sweet soft red fruit with seeds on its surface grown on low plants
examples: Fresh strawberries topped the shortcake with whipped cream
The strawberry patch produced abundant fruit all summer long

definitions: domestic animal that has wandered away from home or has no home
examples: The stray cat appeared at their door every evening for food
Animal shelters work hard to find homes for strays

definitions: long narrow flag or ribbon used as a decoration
person who broadcasts video content live over the internet
examples: Colorful streamers hung from the ceiling for the party
Paper streamers fluttered in the breeze during the parade
The popular streamer attracted thousands of viewers every night
Gaming streamers often interact with their audience in real-time

definitions: method of transmitting or receiving data continuously over the internet
examples: Video streaming services changed how people watch television shows
Music streaming allows access to millions of songs instantly

definitions: passenger vehicle that runs on rails along city streets powered by electricity
examples: The historic streetcar clanged its bell at every crossing
Tourists rode the streetcar through the French Quarter

definitions: act or process of making something stronger or more powerful physically or structurally
examples: Regular exercise leads to muscle strengthening over time
The strengthening of diplomatic ties improved international relations

definitions: something that causes physical, mental, or emotional strain or tension
examples: Work deadlines were a major stressor in her daily life
Identifying stressors helps people manage anxiety more effectively
